titlePart.text: Investigation of foundation soil in situ
titlePart.entryReference: investigation involving boring or specially adapted to earth drilling ,
testing or determining chemical or physical properties in general , e.g. sampling

titlePart.text: Improving or preserving soil or rock, e.g. preserving permafrost soil
titlePart.entryReference: damming or interrupting passage of underground water
soil stabilisation for road building or like purposes ,
compacting soil locally before or while forming foundations ,

titlePart.text: by rolling with rollers usable only for or specially adapted for soil compaction, e.g. sheepsfoot rollers
titlePart.entryReference: rollers for soil working in agriculture
rollers for road paving, such rollers usable also for compacting soil

titlePart.text: by tamping or vibrating, e.g. with auxiliary watering of the soil
titlePart.entryReference: generating or transmitting mechanical vibrations for performing mechanical work in general
tamping or vibrating apparatus for working ballast or railways , for consolidation paving materials , for consolidating concrete in general

titlePart.text: involving penetration of the soil, e.g. vibroflotation
Tampers with directly acting explosion chambers
Vibrating apparatus operating with systems involving reciprocating masses
Vibrating apparatus operating with systems involving rotary unbalanced masses
by inserting stones or lost bodies, e.g. compaction piles
by watering, draining, de-aerating or blasting, e.g. by installing sand or wick drains
by thermal, electrical or electro-chemical means
titlePart.entryReference: freezing soil for interrupting passage of underground water

titlePart.text: Consolidating by placing solidifying or pore-filling substances in the soil
titlePart.entryReference: compositions for conditioning or stabilising foundation soil

titlePart.text: Bulkheads, piles, or other structural elements specially adapted to foundation engineering
Sheet piles or sheet pile bulkheads
Fitted piles or other elements specially adapted for closing gaps between two sheet piles or between two walls of sheet piles
made of concrete or reinforced concrete
Auxiliary devices rigidly or detachably arranged on sheet piles for facilitating assembly
Bulkheads or similar walls made solely of concrete in situ
Bulkheads or similar walls made of prefabricated parts and concrete, including reinforced concrete, in situ
made of timber with or without reinforcement
Means affording protection against spoiling of the wood
Self-cleaning of piles placed in water
made of concrete or reinforced concrete or made of steel and concrete
with arrangements for setting in position by fluid jets
Concrete or concrete-like piles cast in position
making without use of mould-pipes or other moulds
making by use of mould-pipes or other moulds
by making use of pressure liquid or pressure gas for compacting the concrete
with enlarged footing or enlargements at the bottom of the pile
making in situ by forcing bonding agents into gravel fillings or the soil
Piles varying in construction along their length
Piles comprising both precast concrete portions and concrete portions cast in situ
Piles composed of separable parts, e.g. telescopic tubes
Piles with prefabricated supports or anchoring parts
Compacting the soil at the footing or in a casing by forcing cement or like material through tubes
Means for anchoring structural elements or bulkheads
Anchorings for bulkheads or sections thereof
Methods or apparatus for placing sheet pile bulkheads, piles, mould-pipes, or other moulds
Placing by pressure or pulling power
Placing by using several means simultaneously
Placing of hollow piles or mould-pipes by means arranged inside the piles or pipes
Removing sheet pile bulkheads, piles, mould-pipes, or other moulds
Methods or apparatus for both placing and removing sheet pile bulkheads, piles, or mould-pipes
titlePart.entryReference: features relating to placing only , to removing only

titlePart.text: Accessories for placing or removing piles or bulkheads
specially adapted for placing or removing bulkheads
Follow-blocks of pile-drivers or like devices
Handling building or like materials for hydraulic engineering or foundations
titlePart.entryReference: conveying or working-up concrete or similar masses in general

titlePart.text: Handling of bulk concrete specially for foundation purposes
Placing concrete in mould-pipes, pile tubes, boreholes, or narrow shafts
Sinking workpieces into water or soil
Placing gravel or light material under water
Bordering or stiffening the sides of foundation pits
Bordering or stiffening the sides of ditches or narrow shafts for foundations
Back-filling of foundation trenches or ditches
Loosening of soil or rock, under water
Keeping dry foundation sites or other areas in the ground
by employing open ditches arranged below the level of the water
by lowering level of ground water
by damming or interrupting the passage of underground water
by placing or applying sealing substances
titlePart.entryReference: improving soil by chemical substances E02D3/14

titlePart.text: by making use of sealing aprons
titlePart.entryReference: sealings or joints for engineering work

titlePart.text: by displacing the water, e.g. by compressed air
Platforms for mounting tools above water level or above watery ground
titlePart.entryReference: artificial islands mounted on piles or like supports, platforms on legs in general
tunnels submerged into or built in open water

titlePart.text: Caissons able to be floated on water and to be lowered into water in situ
Bringing persons or material into, or out of, compressed air caissons
Decreasing the skin friction while lowering
Jointing caissons to the foundation soil, specially to uneven foundation soil
Joining caissons or like sunk units to each other under water
Foundations formed by making use of caissons
Caisson foundations combined with pile foundations
Caisson foundations made by starting from fixed or floating artificial islands by using protective bulkheads
Foundations constructed by making use of diving-bells
titlePart.entryReference: equipment for dwelling or working under water

titlePart.text: Compacting soil locally before forming foundations
Construction of foundation structures by forcing binding substances into gravel fillings
titlePart.entryReference: consolidating foundation soil in general to E02D3/14

titlePart.text: Stressing the soil or the foundation structure while forming foundations
Foundations made with permanent use of sheet pile bulkheads, walls of planks, or sheet piling boxes
Foundations for sinking or earthquake territories
titlePart.entryReference: building constructions with protection arrangements against earthquakes

titlePart.text: Foundations formed in frozen ground, e.g. in permafrost soil
Foundations formed in moors or bogs
Foundations for large tanks, e.g. oil tanks
Foundations for dams across valleys or for dam constructions
Foundations for poles, masts, or chimneys
Foundations for machines, engines, or ordnance
titlePart.entryReference: special layout of foundations with respect to machinery to be supported

titlePart.text: Foundations for supply conduits or other canals
Foundations inserted underneath exisiting buildings or constructions

titlePart.entryReference: hydraulic engineering, e.g. sealings or joints,

titlePart.text: Making conduits in situ, e.g. of concrete
Making large underground spaces, e.g. for underground plants

titlePart.entryReference: making large underground chambers by underground methods only

titlePart.text: Constructions, or methods of constructing, in water
Tunnels or galleries specially adapted to house conduits, e.g. oil pipe-lines, sewer pipes
Making conduits in situ, e.g. of concrete
titlePart.entryReference: combined with digging of trenches or ditches

titlePart.text: Casings or coverings of boreholes or narrow wells
titlePart.entryReference: boreholes or wells formed by deep drilling

titlePart.text: Covers for manholes or the like
Arrangement or construction of joints in foundation structures
Protective arrangements for foundations or foundation structures
Ground foundation measures for protecting the soil or the subsoil water, e.g. preventing or counteracting oil pollution
against ground humidity or ground water
Watertight packings for use under hydraulic pressure
against corrosion by soil or water
against transmission of vibrations or movements in the foundation soil
against soil pressure or hydraulic pressure

titlePart.entryReference: testing methods and apparatus, see the relevant sub-classes of class
testing structures or apparatus as regards function, in general,
testing or determining chemical or physical properties, in general

titlePart.text: Straightening, lifting, or lowering of foundation structures and of constructions erected on foundations
Repair of damaged foundations or foundation structures
